intro: Cyrtanthera, commonly known as the fringed orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. They are characterized by their showy, often fragrant flowers with distinctive fringed petals. Cyrtanthera species typically have tuberous roots and are often found growing in shaded, moist environments. Their botanical significance lies in their ornamental value and role in local ecosystems.
